definitions: twisted or bent condition in wood or fabric material
theoretical distortion of space-time continuum in physics
examples: The wooden board developed a warp from moisture exposure
Heat caused the plastic to warp beyond repair
Scientists discussed the possibility of warp drive technology
The ship entered warp speed in the science fiction movie

definitions: path taken by warriors going to battle or seeking revenge
examples: The chief led his warriors on the warpath against enemy tribes
She was on the warpath after discovering the betrayal

definitions: act or process of becoming twisted bent or distorted
examples: The warping of the floorboards required immediate attention
Excessive heat caused severe warping in the metal frame

definitions: written guarantee from manufacturer promising repair or replacement of defective items
examples: The new car comes with a five year warranty
Always keep your warranty in case something breaks

definitions: network of interconnected rabbit holes and tunnels underground
densely populated area with narrow streets and passages
examples: The rabbits built an extensive warren beneath the hillside
Wild rabbits emerged from their warren at dusk
The old neighborhood was a warren of alleyways
They lived in a warren of small apartments

definitions: ship equipped with weapons designed for naval warfare
examples: The warship patrolled international waters for security
Several warships participated in the naval exercise

definitions: small hard benign growth on skin caused by virus
examples: The doctor removed the wart from his finger
Common warts usually appear on hands and feet

definitions: wild pig with tusks and facial warts native to Africa
examples: The warthog ran quickly despite its short legs
Warthogs use burrows for shelter from predators

definitions: time period when a country is engaged in war
examples: Food was rationed during wartime to support troops
Many factories switched to wartime production of weapons

definitions: spicy green paste made from Japanese horseradish used with sushi
examples: She added wasabi to her soy sauce for extra heat
The wasabi cleared his sinuses immediately after tasting

definitions: ridged board for scrubbing clothes during washing
well-defined abdominal muscles resembling washboard ridges
examples: Grandmother used a washboard to clean clothes by hand
The old washboard hung on the laundry room wall
His workout routine gave him washboard abs
The fitness model displayed impressive washboard stomach muscles

definitions: machine that washes clothes or dishes automatically
flat ring placed under nut or bolt head
examples: The washer finished its cycle after forty minutes
We need to repair the broken washer before laundry day
Place a washer between the nut and surface
The plumber replaced the worn washer in the faucet

definitions: act or process of cleaning clothes fabric or other items
examples: She hung the washing on the line to dry
The washing took longer than expected this week

definitions: place where flooding or erosion has washed away ground
total failure or disappointment in an event or person
examples: The storm created a dangerous washout on the mountain road
Heavy rains caused multiple washouts along the highway
The outdoor concert was a complete washout due to rain
His business venture turned out to be a washout

definitions: room with toilet and washing facilities for public use
examples: The washroom is located near the main entrance
Please keep the washroom clean for other users

definitions: flying insect with narrow waist and painful sting
examples: A wasp built its nest under the roof eaves
The wasp stung him when he disturbed the nest

definitions: amount lost through waste decay or unproductive use
examples: The company aimed to reduce wastage in production
Food wastage is a serious environmental concern globally

definitions: empty barren land where nothing useful grows or exists
examples: The nuclear accident turned the area into a wasteland
They crossed the wasteland searching for water sources

definitions: water that has been used and contains waste products
examples: The plant treats wastewater before releasing it
Industrial wastewater requires special processing before disposal

definitions: progressive loss of body weight muscle and strength
examples: The disease caused severe muscle wasting over time
Doctors monitored the patient for signs of wasting

definitions: dog trained to guard property and alert to intruders
organization that monitors and reports on specific activities
examples: The watchdog barked loudly when strangers approached the gate
They kept a watchdog to protect their farm
The consumer watchdog investigated complaints about the company
Environmental watchdogs monitor pollution levels in rivers

definitions: person who watches or observes something carefully
examples: Bird watchers gathered in the park with binoculars
The storm watcher tracked the hurricane's path

definitions: act of observing or keeping guard over something
examples: Whale watching attracts many tourists each year
The watching of the house continued throughout the night

definitions: person who makes or repairs watches and clocks
examples: The watchmaker carefully replaced the tiny gear
She apprenticed with a master watchmaker for years

definitions: person employed to keep guard and watch property
examples: The night watchman patrolled the warehouse every hour
A watchman stood guard at the factory gate

definitions: tall tower used for surveillance and watching for danger
examples: Guards kept watch from the castle watchtower
The forest watchtower helped spot fires early

definitions: form of torture where water is poured over covered face
examples: Human rights groups condemned the use of waterboarding
The documentary examined the ethics of waterboarding practices

definitions: paint made with pigments suspended in water-based solution
painting created using watercolor paints on paper
examples: She mixed watercolor paints on her palette
Children enjoyed painting with watercolor sets
The gallery displayed beautiful watercolor landscapes
He collected vintage watercolor paintings from local artists

definitions: paint made with pigments suspended in water-based solution
painting created using watercolour paints on paper
examples: The artist preferred watercolour for its transparency
She taught watercolour techniques at the studio
The watercolour depicted a misty morning scene
His watercolour paintings sold quickly at exhibitions

definitions: natural or artificial channel through which water flows
examples: The watercourse wound through the valley below
Engineers diverted the watercourse to prevent flooding

definitions: any vehicle or vessel designed for traveling on water
examples: Various watercraft filled the busy harbor marina
Personal watercraft require proper safety equipment onboard

definitions: place where water flows over vertical drop in watercourse
examples: The waterfall created a rainbow in its mist
Tourists hiked two miles to reach the waterfall

definitions: birds that swim or live near water including ducks geese swans
examples: Hunters must follow regulations when pursuing waterfowl
The wetland provides habitat for migrating waterfowl

definitions: land or district alongside body of water like harbor or lake
examples: Restaurants line the scenic waterfront attracting tourists
They bought property on the waterfront for development

definitions: act of supplying water to plants or animals
examples: Daily watering keeps the garden healthy and green
The automatic watering system activated every morning

definitions: line on ship's hull showing water level when properly loaded
examples: The waterline paint showed where repairs were needed
Barnacles had attached below the ship's waterline

definitions: final defeat or failure ending someone's success or ambitions
examples: The scandal became his political waterloo
Meeting that deadline proved to be her waterloo

definitions: faint design visible in paper when held to light
translucent design overlaid on digital image for identification
examples: The currency featured an intricate watermark for security
Hold the document up to see its watermark
The photographer added a watermark to protect the image
Remove the watermark after purchasing the stock photo

definitions: large round fruit with green rind and sweet red flesh
examples: We served chilled watermelon at the summer picnic
The watermelon weighed over twenty pounds when harvested

definitions: quality of being impervious to water preventing water penetration
examples: This waterproof jacket keeps you dry in storms
The waterproof seal prevented any moisture damage

definitions: process or material used to make something resistant to water
examples: The basement needs waterproofing to prevent flooding
Waterproofing the deck extends its lifespan significantly

definitions: area of land that drains water to particular watercourse
critical turning point marking important change or development
examples: The watershed covers three counties and feeds the river
Protection of the watershed ensures clean drinking water
The election marked a watershed in the country's history
The invention became a watershed moment for technology

definitions: area or bank immediately next to river lake or sea
examples: They built their cottage on the peaceful waterside
Waterside restaurants offer beautiful views while dining

definitions: river canal or channel used as route for water transport
examples: Barges transport goods along the industrial waterway
The waterway connects two major ports for shipping

definitions: large wheel turned by flowing water to generate power
examples: The old mill's waterwheel still turns after restoration
Waterwheels provided power before electricity was available

definitions: unit of power equal to one joule per second
examples: This light bulb uses only sixty watts
The microwave operates at one thousand watts

definitions: distance between successive crests of wave especially electromagnetic radiation
particular way of thinking showing mutual understanding between people
examples: Radio stations broadcast on different wavelengths
Scientists measured the wavelength of the light spectrum
We're on the same wavelength about this project
They operated on completely different wavelengths
